action.primary: Absorbs fluids, reduces swelling and stops bleeding
Eliminates toxins and kills parasites topically
Drives Phlegm downward and suppresses childhood convulsions

indications: Chronic dysenteric disorders and childhood convulsions

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Blood Deficiency.

useCases: Severe underarm odor, tinea versicolor, vitiligo, scabies, eczema and pemphigus
Grind with 30g of Mi Tuo Seng into powder and mix with petroleum jelly and apply topically for general dermatological disorders

notes: This herb is primarily used topically. It is not generally for Internal use.
The effects Mi Tuo Seng and Minium #{QianDan} Qian Dan are the same and can be substituted for each other.
It can be used alone for fungal infections.
This was one of the main minerals used in medieval Taoist alchemy. It was believed to possess the ability to transform copper into gold.
It was used in the preparation of longevity elixirs.
